history: [system] Hello, I am here to assist you with making Fry Sauce. [user] Okay - great. First of all, what ingredients do I need? [system] You don't actually necessarily need too many ingredients. We can make this with as few ingredients as just ketchup and mayonnaise. However, we can also make substitutions (like ketchup with barbeque sauce, or mayonaise with miracle whip). Also optional are ground spices, hot sauce, vinegar, and pickle juice if you have it.

history: [system] Start by getting a boxed cake mix, make this in a large bowl according to the box instructions. [user] I don't have prepared mix... [system] No Problem, instead, weigh out 3 medium eggs together. Whatever the 3 eggs weigh, use equal amounts of butter, caster sugar and self raising flour to form your cake mix. Do you need more detailed instructions for this or do you know what you're doing? [user] A little more details. What's the size of cake we can make with 3 eggs? [system] The size of the cake should be big enough make 2 12 inch rounded cakes or 12 smaller cupcakes. Depending on what size you are looking for. Do you need further instructions to make the cake or do you know how to make a basic vanilla sponge of this kind? [user] Just to double check, are you sure 3 eggs are enough for 2 12-inch cakes or 12 cupcakes? [system] Yes, from previous personal experience, this is the correct amount. [user] Ok, I believe you. Just one more question about the mix, what do you mean by "equal amounts of butter, caster sugar and self raising flour"? [system] The amount of butter you should add should be equivalent to the weight of the 3 eggs that you have weighed on your scales. You should mix this butter with your caster sugar until light and fluffy. You need to use the same weight of caster sugar to that of the weight of your 3 eggs. Once this is done, add a 5ml teaspoon vanilla extract before adding your 3 eggs. Mix this with a mechanical or hand whisk until it lightens in colour. It should be a light yellow colour. Once this is done, weigh out the same amount of your self raising flour to that of the weight of your eggs and gently fold it in with a spatula. We fold the flour in to avoid beating out the air from the mixture, as doing this would prevent the cake from rising.

history: [system] Hello! Would you like to learn how to keep green onions fresh? [user] Hello! Yes, I am definitely interested in learning how to keep green onions fresh! [system] Fabulous! What you'll want to do is fill a glass or a tall jar with 1-2 inches of cold or room temp water (not warm!). history: [system] Hello! So today we are going to learning how to grill shrimp skewers. Have you got any wooden or metal skewers?

history: [system] Hello! So today we are going to learning how to grill shrimp skewers. Have you got any wooden or metal skewers? [user] Hi! Yes I have metal ones just in my drawer. [system] Okay perfect, metal skewers work well! So let's begin by putting the shrimp onto the skewers. You can do this by thrusting the skewer through the tail and into the midsection of the shrimp. history: [system] Do you have the peels cut? [user] Yes, I've cut the peels. Do I put the fruit aside? [system] You can eat the fruit if you like. [system] When the water is boiled, you turn off the heat. You need to drain all the water out and put the peels back in the saucepan. Repeat this two more times. If you have an instant-read thermometer, you should also use it now. The syrup has to be hot enough (110 degrees/230 F) in order to candy the peels properly. What we want to do now is place all the peels into the syrup -- slowly!! -- and stir them in. Turn the heat down to a simmer and stop stirring. Now you need to let the strips simmer for 30 minutes. It could be more or less depending on the temperature.

[user] How will I know when it's ready? [system] Two ways: when it starts to thicken and get really sticky. If you have an instant-read thermometer, you should also use it now. The syrup has to be hot enough (110 degrees/230 F) in order to candy the peels properly. What we want to do now is place all the peels into the syrup -- slowly!! -- and stir them in. Turn the heat down to a simmer and stop stirring. Now you need to let the strips simmer for 30 minutes. It could be more or less depending on the temperature. [user] How will I know when it's simmered for long enough? [system] The strips will look almost clear/translucent. Once they are at that point, you need to dry the strips out. Turn off the burner and scoop the strips out with a fork or slotted spoon. Spread them out on a wire rack with some paper towel underneath and leave them somewhere cool and dry for 4-5 hours. Once they're as dry as you like, they're ready to eat.

If you have an instant-read thermometer, you should also use it now. The syrup has to be hot enough (110 degrees/230 F) in order to candy the peels properly. Once they are at that point, you need to dry the strips out. Turn off the burner and scoop the strips out with a fork or slotted spoon. Spread them out on a wire rack with some paper towel underneath and leave them somewhere cool and dry for 4-5 hours. Once they're as dry as you like, they're ready to eat. [user] Can I add anything else to the strips? Like sugar or spices? [system] Yes! If you'd like some extra flavour, you should roll the strips in sugar or powdered spices now, while they're sticky and before they start drying out. Once dry, they're finished! You can use them in many different ways, like in desserts, or you can just eat them on their own. You can dip them in chocolate as well, but if you do make sure they are stored in the fridge.

history: [system] When your pouch begins to smoke, it's time to turn off all the burners except the one under your pouch. Place the turkey legs on the grill, on the side without any flames, and make sure to leave the pouch inside or else you won't get your lovely smoked turkey legs! [user] Ok, flames are off and the meat is on! But how will the meat cook if there is no flames? [system] The heat from the flame under the pouch will allow the meat to smoke from the indirect heat. If you can, try to elevate the meat above the pouch to allow the smoke to circulate around the meat, although you did say that you were not able to move the plate so don't stress if you can't elevate the meat, it will still taste amazing! What does it smell like now? Does it smell nice and smoky? [user] That's ok, I can't move the plate so I'm glad it will still taste good! It smells smoky and like it might be starting to cook, how long do I need to smoke it for? [system] Awesome, you will need to smoke the turkey legs for approximately 2.5-3.5 hours for best results, please close the lid and turn the heat down to medium. This ensures that the temperature of the grills remains between 245F (118C) and 260F (127C), but make sure that you smoke the legs until they reach an internal temperature of 165F (74C). Do you have a meat thermometer handy to keep an eye on the temperature? [user] Temperature is down and meat thermometer is at the ready, but the smoke pouch has stopped smoking, what should I do? No I've never done that before. How should I begin? [system] Okay, that's no problem! First off, we want to make sure we buy the right type of shrimp so that everything will go smoothly. It is best to buy large shrimp, this way the shrimp won't fall through the grill and won't overcook as easy as small shrimp. For this recipe, it's best to buy either U/10 or U/20 shrimp which means 10 or 20 shrimp per pound. We can either use fresh or frozen shrimp; which will you be using today? [user] I have some frozen shrimp already in the freezer, so I'll use that. [system] Okay, sounds good! So with frozen shrimp we will want to thaw them. You can either thaw them in the refrigerator overnight or if you want to save time, rinse them under cold water for an hour. Once they've thawed, you'll want to rinse them one last time with cold water and then drain them in a colander. Afterwards, pat them dry with paper towels. Shrimp, when properly thawed, should look slightly translucent. Is your shrimp properly thawed?
user_utt: [user] Does it have to be under the tap continuously for an hour?

history: [system] Hello, I hope you're well. Today we are going to learn how to clean and season shrimp. Have you ever cleaned and seasoned shrimp before? [user] Hi! I'm doing great. No I've never done that before. How should I begin? [system] Okay, that's no problem! First off, we want to make sure we buy the right type of shrimp so that everything will go smoothly. It is best to buy large shrimp, this way the shrimp won't fall through the grill and won't overcook as easy as small shrimp. For this recipe, it's best to buy either U/10 or U/20 shrimp which means 10 or 20 shrimp per pound. We can either use fresh or frozen shrimp; which will you be using today? [user] I have some frozen shrimp already in the freezer, so I'll use that. [system] Okay, sounds good! So with frozen shrimp we will want to thaw them. You can either thaw them in the refrigerator overnight or if you want to save time, rinse them under cold water for an hour. Once they've thawed, you'll want to rinse them one last time with cold water and then drain them in a colander. Afterwards, pat them dry with paper towels. Shrimp, when properly thawed, should look slightly translucent. Is your shrimp properly thawed? [user] Does it have to be under the tap continuously for an hour? [system] You shouldn't have to rinse them continiously. You can leave them in the cold water and simply replace the water every so often until they are thawed! [user] Sounds good. They look translucent now, I think they're fully thawed. [system] Okay, perfect! Now we'll need to devein your shrimp if you haven't boughten already deveined shrimp. To check if you have to devein the shrimp, see if there is a black vein running down the black of the shrimp. If there is, you'll need to peel and devein them. To do this, start at the top of the shrimp and cut through the shrimp's shell with a pair of scissors, making sure to not cut through the meat. You can cut all the way down to the tail or stop and leave the tail. Leaving the tail will allow you to more easily handle the shrimp for dipping if you want to eat your shrimp with a sauce. Once you've peeled the excess shell throw it away. Now that we've peeled the shrimp, we need to devein. You can do this by using a small sharp knife and cutting down the back of the shrimp and removing the back vein. After deveining the shrimp, rinse under cold water. And if you've already bought deveined shrimp you can ignore all of this and begin seasoning! How's your shrimp looking? Are you ready to begin seasoning?
user_utt: [user] I specifically only buy deveined shrimp to ignore all of this anyway so assume I can just move on to seasoning!

history: [system] Hi there, hope your day is going well. How can I help you with this recipe [user] I am interested in cooking Country style ribs, I have all the ingredients, how do I start preparing this? [system] That's great that you have all the ingredients already! You first need to preheat the oven to 300 degrees F or 149 degrees C and you need to line a baking sheet with foil and parchment paper and lay the ribs out in a single layer. After you have done that, please cover the ribs with foil and bake them for at least 2 hours.
user_utt: [user] Okay fantastic, what's the next step?

After you have done that, please cover the ribs with foil and bake them for at least 2 hours. [user] Okay fantastic, what's the next step? [system] After the ribs have been baked for at least 2 hours, remove the ribs and drain the grease into a can to throw away later. If however, the ribs don't seem tender, please cook the ribs for a further 15-30 minutes. After you have done this you can brush the ribs with sauce for added flavour.
